page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This block lies at the southwesterly end of th CANDOVER VALLEY which runs between BASINGSTOKE and ALRESFORD in the county of HAMPSHIRE. It is a very rural area with a low population (160 people). The only real commercial activity is agriculture. The population is a mixture of middle aged professional people, younger people in "white collar" employment, retired people and agricultural workers. The standards of living are in general high and almost all the population have chosen to live here because of a liking for this rural area which has considerable natural beauty. There is a strong community feeling and much local social activity. Current planning policy should ensure the retention of the status quo.
